title._content: [Private Edward A. Cary of Company I, 44th Virginia Infantry Regiment, in uniform and his sister, Emma J. Garland née Cary] (LOC)

description._content: Rees, Charles R.,, photographer. [Private Edward A. Cary of Company I, 44th Virginia Infantry Regiment, in uniform and his sister, Emma J. Garland née Cary] [between 1861 and 1862] 1 photograph : sixth-plate ambrotype, hand-colored ; 9.2 x 8.3 cm (case) Notes: Title devised by Library staff. Notation in ink on manuscript recto: Edward Carey [i.e., Cary], Emma Carey (Mrs. J. G. Garland). Edward A. Carey was killed in the battle of Port Royal, June 9, 1861 [i.e., 1862]. Case: Berg, no. 2-37. Photograph shows identified soldier and woman; manuscript found with photograph. Deposit; Tom Liljenquist; 2012; (2010:105-5) Purchased from: Bill Turner, La Plata, Maryland, 2011. Forms part of: Liljenquist Family Collection of Civil War Photographs (Library of Congress). Forms part of: Ambrotype/Tintype photograph filing series (Library of Congress). Subjects: Cary, Edward A.,--ca. 1843-1862. Garland, Emma J.,--1845-1918. Confederate States of America.--Army.--Virginia Infantry Regiment, 44th--People--1860-1870. Soldiers--Confederate--1860-1870. Military uniforms--Confederate--1860-1870. Families--1860-1870. Women--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military personnel--Confederate. Format: Group portraits--1860-1870. Portrait photographs--1860-1870. Ambrotypes--Hand-colored--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Ambrotype/Tintype filing series (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650518 Liljenquist Family collection (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650519 More information about this collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.lilj Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.32599 Call Number: AMB/TIN no. 2854
